title: Shared Responsibility in International Law
descriptions:
Here is a 267-word abstract for the grant proposal:

Title: Shared Responsibility in International Law (SHARES)

The SHARES project tackles the pressing issue of allocating responsibilities in international cooperative actions, where the involvement of multiple actors can lead to dilution of responsibility and undermine the rule of law. The project's primary objectives are to rethink the allocation of international responsibilities, address the problem of responsibility dilution, ensure the protection of the international rule of law, and provide remedies for injured parties.

The SHARES project will overcome the challenges of determining individual actor responsibility in collective actions and the undermining of key objectives due to shared responsibility. Our approach involves uncovering the extent and nature of scattered international responsibilities and developing new perspectives on matching cooperation with a system of responsibility.

The project will focus on two key areas: the principles of holding multiple actors collectively, jointly, or proportionately responsible, and the processes for (quasi-)judicial systems to account for collective international policies. Our methodology combines a conceptual and theoretical foundation with an empirical approach through case-studies.

By exploring the problem of scattered responsibilities and providing solutions for better matching international cooperation with a proper system of shared responsibility, SHARES aims to ensure that international cooperation is effective, accountable, and just. The project's outcomes will have significant implications for the development of international law and the promotion of global governance.
